page.title: 17LOCAL EVENTS 1985 CONTINUED.
page.content: THROCKMORTON FETE was held on Saturday 24th August and opened at 2.30 p.m. There was a skittle alley, tombola, plants, cakes, produce, local crafts, Punch and Judy and a number of childrens stalls.One balloon in the balloon race was reported to have travelled to Peterborough. Teas, beer and sandwiches were served while people listened to Bretforton Silver Band. The raffle was then drawn. Despite rather unsettled weather the fete made a profit of Â£500. PRODUCE AND CRAFT FAIR -7th September In the villages hall, the entries: vegetables, fruit, flowers, jams, wine cakes, knitwear, dress-making and other items, were judged and the hall was opened to the public . Entries were disappointing but this was put down to a very bad summer. The produce was auctioned off. Profit Â£70 overall.
